page.title: 08GAMES IN THE PLAYGROUND - 1
page.content: In all parts of the{country}children play games at breaktime in the school playground. The games played are the same in various areas but have different names. Here is a selection of games described by some six year olds from Mrs. Baker's set. Some are seasonal games, but most are playes all the year round. {Hopscotch} A squared shape is drawn on the ground and numbered from 1 to 10. Any number of children can play. A stone is thrown on to a numbered square and the child has to hop and skip along the squares and pick up the stone. If the stone lands on the wrong number or the child loses balance and fails to pick up the stone, then the child is out of the game. {Chase} This game is known by several different names.
